critique: This document pertains to the inspection of income tax returns of tax-exempt organizations by a House Select Committee. It is difficult to assess a strong ideological tilt based on this action alone. It could be argued that examining tax-exempt organizations could be seen as either a conservative or liberal action, depending on the intent and how the information is used. There is no direct impact on immigration. The order grants access to information, which could be seen as a slight expansion of executive power, although it is in service of a congressional committee. The order does not obviously shift power between state and federal entities. There is a slight impact on civil liberties as it relates to privacy, but it is balanced by the need for oversight. The order has a moderate impact on economic regulation as it relates to tax-exempt organizations. The order has no direct impact on social inclusion.
